verses.niv: 1 Whoever loves discipline loves knowledge, but he who hates correction is stupid.
verses.kjv: 1 Whoso loveth instruction loveth knowledge: but he that hateth reproof is brutish.
verses.esv:
12:1   Whoever loves discipline loves knowledge,
    but he who hates reproof is stupid.

verses.niv: 11 No discipline seems pleasant at the time, but painful. Later on, however, it produces a harvest of righteousness and peace for those who have been trained by it.
verses.kjv: 11 Now no chastening for the present seemeth to be joyous, but grievous: nevertheless afterward it yieldeth the peaceable fruit of righteousness unto them which are exercised thereby.
verses.esv: 11 For the moment all discipline seems painful rather than pleasant, but later it yields the peaceful fruit of righteousness to those who have been trained by it.

verses.niv: 24 He who spares the rod hates his son, but he who loves him is careful to discipline him.
verses.kjv: 24 He that spareth his rod hateth his son: but he that loveth him chasteneth him betimes.
verses.esv:
24   Whoever spares the rod hates his son,
    but he who loves him is diligent to discipline him.

verses.niv: 27 No, I beat my body and make it my slave so that after I have preached to others, I myself will not be disqualified for the prize.
verses.kjv: 27 But I keep under my body, and bring it into subjection: lest that by any means, when I have preached to others, I myself should be a castaway.
verses.esv: 27 But I discipline my body and keep it under control, lest after preaching to others I myself should be disqualified.

verses.niv: 19 Those whom I love I rebuke and discipline. So be earnest, and repent.
verses.esv: 19 Those whom I love, I reprove and discipline, so be zealous and repent.
verses.kjv: 19 As many as I love, I rebuke and chasten: be zealous therefore, and repent.

verses.niv: 11 My son, do not despise the LORD's discipline and do not resent his rebuke, 12 because the LORD disciplines those he loves, as a father the son he delights in.
verses.esv:
11   My son, do not despise the LORD’s discipline
    or be weary of his reproof,
12   for the LORD reproves him whom he loves,
    as a father the son in whom he delights.
verses.kjv: 11 My son, despise not the chastening of the LORD; neither be weary of his correction: 12 For whom the LORD loveth he correcteth; even as a father the son in whom he delighteth.

verses.niv: 13 Do not withhold discipline from a child; if you punish him with the rod, he will not die.
verses.esv:
13   Do not withhold discipline from a child;
    if you strike him with a rod, he will not die.
verses.kjv: 13 Withhold not correction from the child: for if thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die.

verses.niv: 15 The rod of correction imparts wisdom, but a child left to himself disgraces his mother.
verses.esv:
15   The rod and reproof give wisdom,
    but a child left to himself brings shame to his mother.
verses.kjv: 15 The rod and reproof give wisdom: but a child left to himself bringeth his mother to shame.

verses.niv: 17 Discipline your son, and he will give you peace; he will bring delight to your soul.
verses.esv:
17   Discipline your son, and he will give you rest;
    he will give delight to your heart.
verses.kjv: 17 Correct thy son, and he shall give thee rest; yea, he shall give delight unto thy soul.

verses.niv: 5 And you have forgotten that word of encouragement that addresses you as sons: "My son, do not make light of the Lord's discipline, and do not lose heart when he rebukes you, 6 because the Lord disciplines those he loves, and he punishes everyone he accepts as a son."
verses.esv:
5 And have you forgotten the exhortation that addresses you as sons?

  “My son, do not regard lightly the discipline of the Lord,
    nor be weary when reproved by him.
6   For the Lord disciplines the one he loves,
    and chastises every son whom he receives.”
verses.kjv: 5 And ye have forgotten the exhortation which speaketh unto you as unto children, My son, despise not thou the chastening of the Lord, nor faint when thou art rebuked of him: 6 For whom the Lord loveth he chasteneth, and scourgeth every son whom he receiveth.

verses.niv: 8 Rather he must be hospitable, one who loves what is good, who is self-controlled, upright, holy and disciplined.
verses.esv: 8 but hospitable, a lover of good, self-controlled, upright, holy, and disciplined.
verses.kjv: 8 But a lover of hospitality, a lover of good men, sober, just, holy, temperate;

verses.niv: 28 Like a city whose walls are broken down is a man who lacks self-control.
verses.esv:
28   A man without self-control
    is like a city broken into and left without walls.
verses.kjv: 28 He that hath no rule over his own spirit is like a city that is broken down, and without walls.

verses.esv: 4 Fathers, do not provoke your children to anger, but bring them up in the discipline and instruction of the Lord.
verses.niv: 4 Fathers, do not exasperate your children; instead, bring them up in the training and instruction of the Lord.
verses.kjv: 4 And, ye fathers, provoke not your children to wrath: but bring them up in the nurture and admonition of the Lord.

verses.esv:
15   Folly is bound up in the heart of a child,
    but the rod of discipline drives it far from him.
verses.niv: 15 Folly is bound up in the heart of a child, but the rod of discipline will drive it far from him.
verses.kjv: 15 Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.

verses.esv:
23   For the commandment is a lamp and the teaching a light,
    and the reproofs of discipline are the way of life,
verses.niv: 23 For these commands are a lamp, this teaching is a light, and the corrections of discipline are the way to life,
verses.kjv: 23 For the commandment is a lamp; and the law is light; and reproofs of instruction are the way of life:

verses.esv:
5 And have you forgotten the exhortation that addresses you as sons?

  “My son, do not regard lightly the discipline of the Lord,
    nor be weary when reproved by him.
6   For the Lord disciplines the one he loves,
    and chastises every son whom he receives.”

7 It is for discipline that you have to endure. God is treating you as sons. For what son is there whom his father does not discipline? 8 If you are left without discipline, in which all have participated, then you are illegitimate children and not sons. 9 Besides this, we have had earthly fathers who disciplined us and we respected them. Shall we not much more be subject to the Father of spirits and live? 10 For they disciplined us for a short time as it seemed best to them, but he disciplines us for our good, that we may share his holiness. 11 For the moment all discipline seems painful rather than pleasant, but later it yields the peaceful fruit of righteousness to those who have been trained by it.
verses.niv: 5 And you have forgotten that word of encouragement that addresses you as sons: "My son, do not make light of the Lord's discipline, and do not lose heart when he rebukes you, 6 because the Lord disciplines those he loves, and he punishes everyone he accepts as a son." 7 Endure hardship as discipline; God is treating you as sons. For what son is not disciplined by his father? 8 If you are not disciplined (and everyone undergoes discipline), then you are illegitimate children and not true sons. 9 Moreover, we have all had human fathers who disciplined us and we respected them for it. How much more should we submit to the Father of our spirits and live! 10 Our fathers disciplined us for a little while as they thought best; but God disciplines us for our good, that we may share in his holiness. 11 No discipline seems pleasant at the time, but painful. Later on, however, it produces a harvest of righteousness and peace for those who have been trained by it.
verses.kjv: 5 And ye have forgotten the exhortation which speaketh unto you as unto children, My son, despise not thou the chastening of the Lord, nor faint when thou art rebuked of him: 6 For whom the Lord loveth he chasteneth, and scourgeth every son whom he receiveth. 7 If ye endure chastening, God dealeth with you as with sons; for what son is he whom the father chasteneth not? 8 But if ye be without chastisement, whereof all are partakers, then are ye bastards, and not sons. 9 Furthermore we have had fathers of our flesh which corrected us, and we gave them reverence: shall we not much rather be in subjection unto the Father of spirits, and live? 10 For they verily for a few days chastened us after their own pleasure; but he for our profit, that we might be partakers of his holiness. 11 Now no chastening for the present seemeth to be joyous, but grievous: nevertheless afterward it yieldeth the peaceable fruit of righteousness unto them which are exercised thereby.

verses.esv: 7 for God gave us a spirit not of fear but of power and love and self-control.
verses.niv: 7 For God did not give us a spirit of timidity, but a spirit of power, of love and of self-discipline.
verses.kjv: 7 For God hath not given us the spirit of fear; but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind.

verses.esv:
13:1   A wise son hears his father’s instruction,
    but a scoffer does not listen to rebuke.
verses.niv: 1 A wise son heeds his father's instruction, but a mocker does not listen to rebuke.
verses.kjv: 1 A wise son heareth his father’s instruction: but a scorner heareth not rebuke.

verses.esv:
13   Love not sleep, lest you come to poverty;
    open your eyes, and you will have plenty of bread.
verses.niv: 13 Do not love sleep or you will grow poor; stay awake and you will have food to spare.
verses.kjv: 13 Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty; open thine eyes, and thou shalt be satisfied with bread.

verses.esv: 17 Obey your leaders and submit to them, for they are keeping watch over your souls, as those who will have to give an account. Let them do this with joy and not with groaning, for that would be of no advantage to you.
verses.niv: 17 Obey your leaders and submit to their authority. They keep watch over you as men who must give an account. Obey them so that their work will be a joy, not a burden, for that would be of no advantage to you.
verses.kjv: 17 Obey them that have the rule over you, and submit yourselves: for they watch for your souls, as they that must give account, that they may do it with joy, and not with grief: for that is unprofitable for you.

verses.niv: 18 Discipline your son, for in that there is hope; do not be a willing party to his death.
verses.kjv: 18 Chasten thy son while there is hope, and let not thy soul spare for his crying.
verses.esv:
18   Discipline your son, for there is hope;
    do not set your heart on putting him to death.
7 Have nothing to do with irreverent, silly myths. Rather train yourself for godliness;
verses.niv: 7 Have nothing to do with godless myths and old wives' tales; rather, train yourself to be godly.
verses.kjv: 7 But refuse profane and old wives’ fables, and exercise thyself rather unto godliness.

verses.esv: 15 Do your best to present yourself to God as one approved, a worker who has no need to be ashamed, rightly handling the word of truth.
verses.niv: 15 Do your best to present yourself to God as one approved, a workman who does not need to be ashamed and who correctly handles the word of truth.
verses.kjv: 15 Study to shew thyself approved unto God, a workman that needeth not to be ashamed, rightly dividing the word of truth.

verses.esv:
17   “Behold, blessed is the one whom God reproves;
    therefore despise not the discipline of the Almighty.
verses.kjv: 17 Behold, happy is the man whom God correcteth: therefore despise not thou the chastening of the Almighty:
verses.niv: 17 "Blessed is the man whom God corrects; so do not despise the discipline of the Almighty.

verses.esv:
17   Whoever heeds instruction is on the path to life,
    but he who rejects reproof leads others astray.
verses.kjv: 17 He is in the way of life that keepeth instruction: but he that refuseth reproof erreth.
verses.niv: 17 He who heeds discipline shows the way to life, but whoever ignores correction leads others astray.
